conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through baffles to predict which container it will flow into.
Baffle A is pointing towards container D.
Baffle B is pointing towards container E.
Baffle C is pointing towards container E.
Liquid from A will flow into container D.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
Liquid from C will flow into container E.
The image shows liquid flowing out from A, B, and C and being directed into containers D and E.
Liquid from A is directed towards D.
Liquid from B is directed towards E.
Liquid from C is directed towards E.
The liquid from A will flow into container D.
The liquid from B will flow into container E.
The liquid from C will flow into container E.
